steps.title: Go to https://prezi.com.
steps.content: Go to https://prezi.com . You can use any web browser to save a Prezi to your local computer.

steps.title: Sign in or create an account.
steps.content: Sign in or create an account. If you're signing up to use Prezi for the first time, you get a 7-Day free trial. You need a paid account in order to use the Prezi desktop app and download a Prezi to your computer. Click Get Started or log in to continue.

steps.title: Download the Prezi desktop app.
steps.content: Download the Prezi desktop app. When you log in with a paid account, you'll see a link in the bottom left corner of your screen that says "Get the Prezi desktop app." Click that and follow the on-screen instructions to download and install the app. [1] X Research source A free, or basic, account cannot download or use the Prezi desktop application.

steps.title: Open Prezi.
steps.content: Open Prezi. You'll find this program in your Start Menu or Applications folder.

steps.title: Log in.
steps.content: Log in. Enter your Prezi username and password to log in. You'll be directed to your dashboard where you can manage existing presentations as well as create new ones.

steps.title: Create a new presentation or select an existing one.
steps.content: Create a new presentation or select an existing one. If you're connected to the internet, your Prezi will auto-save. If you need to know more about making a new presentation, look at the method for making a presentation in How to Use Prezi. Located above your Prezi, on the left side of the screen, is a cloud icon. A check mark inside the cloud icon means your presentation has been saved. A rotating circle of arrows means it is currently saving. To force a cloud-save, go to ☰ > Save.

steps.title: Go to your dashboard.
steps.content: Go to your dashboard. If you're editing a presentation, click ☰ > My presentations.

steps.title: Click ⋮ in the bottom right corner of the presentation thumbnail you want to download.
steps.content: Click ⋮ in the bottom right corner of the presentation thumbnail you want to download. A menu will appear.

steps.title: Click Download.
steps.content: Click Download . You can only download your presentation if you have a paid account. You can also click Export to PDF instead to save the file as a PDF instead of an EXE or ZIP. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Choose where you want to save the presentation and click OK.
steps.content: Choose where you want to save the presentation and click OK . The file may take a few seconds to download, depending on your internet speed. [3] X Research source
